value.title: Remove CONFUSION in your Power BI report with this little feature
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you a little known Power BI feature to help your report consumers use every bit of your report. Removing confusion and maximizing use!  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton --

value.title: RLS with TWO Fact tables in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you struggled with using Row-Level Security (RLS) on a dimension connected to two fact tables? Patrick looks at some options you can use to accomplish this in Power BI.  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Simulate Hierarchies with Field Parameters in Power BI
value.excerpt: Struggling with field parameters and hierarchies in Power BI? They just don't work! Patrick has an approach that looks to simulate hierarchies by using field parameters in this way.  Let report readers use field parameters to change visuals (preview) https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/power-bi-field-parameters

value.title: Smart Narratives and Conditional Formatting in Power BI? Yes please!

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Understanding the basics of Power BI Premium

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI
value.excerpt: You can take advantage of the R Script showcase to start using R Visuals with your reports. These provide great examples of what your R Script should look like to interact with data and you can compare how your visual looks to the example.   R Script Showcase - http://community.powerbi.com/t5/R-Script-Showcase/bd-p/RVisuals

value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
value.excerpt: You need a connector to work with data in Power Query for Power BI or Excel. But what is a connector? Adam explains what these are and how to find out what's available.  Power Query Connectors: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/connectors/  Power BI data sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources

value.title: What is a Common Table Expression (CTE) and how do you use them?
value.excerpt: We've had some questions about what a Common Table Expression (CTE) is. Patrick describes what they are and how you can use them in SQL Server or Azure Synapse Analytics.  WITH common_table_expression (Transact-SQL) https://learn.microsoft.com/sql/t-sql/queries/with-common-table-expression-transact-sql?view=sql-server-ver16

value.title: What's the real size of your data model in Power BI?

value.title: How to Show Items with No Data in Power BI (e.g. Show All Month Names)
value.excerpt: Sometimes the default behavior in Power BI can be frustrating. For example, if you are showing month names, you may see that if no data is available then those months may not be shown in your Chart or Table. Often, you would want all months (Jan-Dec) to be shown, regardless of whether data is present

value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.title: Append vs Merge in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Combining two queries in Power Query or in Power BI is one of the most basic and also essential tasks that you would need to do in most of data preparation scenarios. There are two types of combining queries; Merge, and Append. Database developers easily understand the difference, but the majority of

value.title: Export the Data of a Power BI table entirely in a few Clicks
value.excerpt: If you want to export the data of a Power BI table, you have options such as copy and paste, or putting it in a visual and export it. However, there is an easier way available too. You can use Power BI Helper (free tool) to export the entire data of the table. The instruction below explains how it is
